columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to assess the formula in determining the value of a right.

As we have noted in the previous items, the value of the right can be computed as follows: 


$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Value of the right}&={\text{ P}_{RO}}{\text{- P}_{X}}\\

\end{aligned}$$ 

Where:
 
$${\text{P}_{RO}} = {\text{Rights-on price}} \\

{\text{P}_{X}} = {\text{Ex-rights price}} \\

Then, we have also noted the computation for the ex-rights price which is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
{\text{P}_{X}}&=\dfrac{{\text{(N $\times$}}{\text{P}_{RO}}{{)}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where:
 
$${\text{P}_{RO}} = {\text{Rights-on price}} \\

{\text{P}_{X}} = {\text{Ex-rights price}} \\
{\text{P}_{S}} = {\text{Subscription price}} \\
{\text{N}} = {\text{Rights needed}} \\

Now that we have the formula on how to compute the value right, we will now combine both formulas from steps 3 and 4 in order for us to determine if it can be written like the formula from step 2. This is done as follows: 


$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Value of the right}&={\text{ P}_{RO}}{{-}}\dfrac{{\text{(N $\times$}}{\text{P}_{RO}}{{)}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\\\
&={\text{ P}_{RO}}{{-}}\dfrac{{\text{N}}{\text{P}_{RO}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\\\

\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us multiply the (1 + N) or the rights needed to the rights-on price.

$$\begin{aligned}

\text{Value of the right}&=\dfrac{{\text{(1 + N) $\times$}}{\text{ P}_{RO}}{{-}}{{\text{N}}{\text{P}_{RO}}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\\\
&=\dfrac{{\text{(1 + N) $\times$}}{\text{ P}_{RO}}{{-}}{{\text{N}}{\text{P}_{RO}}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\\\
&=\dfrac{{\text{N}}{\text{P}_{RO}}{\text{ + P}_{RO}}{{-}}{{\text{N}}{\text{P}_{RO}}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\\\
&=\dfrac{{\text{ P}_{RO}}{\text{+ P}_{S}}}{\text{1 + N}}\\\\

\end{aligned}$$
**Hence, relying on how we rearranged the formula from step 6, the formula may be expressed just as it was in step 2.**
